Spaces

These hubs across Europe offer online and real world places you can go to play, develop, test and build.

  • Add a Lab
  • Lab best practices
  • Help improve this content

  • i-Matériel.Lab | Paris

    i-Matériel.Lab is the user driven innovation platform dedicated to Cultural Heritage and Tourism, specialized in mobile products and services (Smartphones, touch screen Tablets and Smart Objects).

    Read more→

  • AALTO Fab Lab | Helsinki

    FabLab (fabrication laboratory) is a small-scale workshop for digital fabrication, started by MIT. In a Fablab you can find machines such as the lasercutter, vinyl cutter, desktop CNC milling machine and 3D printer and electronics prototyping equipment.

    Read more→

  • Future Classroom Lab | Brussels

    The Future Classroom Lab in Brussels is a fully equipped, reconfigurable, teaching and learning space developed by European Schoolnet, its 30 supporting Ministries of Education and leading educational technology providers.

    Read more→

  • Platoniq | Palma

    The Future Classroom Lab in Brussels is a fully equipped, reconfigurable, teaching and learning space developed by European Schoolnet, its 30 supporting Ministries of Education and leading educational technology providers.

    Read more→
